summary: This is an email from Bobbi Sternheim, an attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, to Christian Everdell, notifying them of a breach in the secure Webex line used for confidential attorney-client communications. The email references a court order from August 25th and alleges that Maxwell and an MDC Case Manager witnessed suspicious activity during a VTC session, contradicting prior government and MDC assurances about the security of these communications.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Author of the email, notifying the recipient of interference with Ghislaine Maxwell's secure attorney-client communication line. She references a court order and demands an explanation.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Recipient of the email (Cc'd), presumably a government prosecutor involved in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated defendant whose confidential attorney-client video teleconference (VTC) session was allegedly interfered with. She observed and reported the suspicious activity.

persons.name: Case Manager
persons.context: An MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) staff member who witnessed the suspicious activity on the VTC monitor alongside Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Sternheim is Maxwell's defense attorney, communicating about a breach in their privileged communication channel.
Sternheim is corresponding with Everdell, a prosecutor, regarding a legal matter concerning her client's communication rights.
Both Maxwell and the MDC Case Manager witnessed the suspicious activity on the VTC monitor, making the Case Manager a witness to Maxwell's complaint.

events.title: Suspicious VTC Activity Observed
events.description: At the conclusion of a video teleconference (VTC) session, Ghislaine Maxwell observed suspicious activity on the monitor. She alerted MDC staff, and a Case Manager witnessed the activity, indicating potential interference with her secure attorney-client communications.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: The court issued an order (referenced as attached) regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's communications with counsel.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney alleges a new breach of the secure Webex line used for confidential attorney-client communications.
Maxwell and an MDC Case Manager both witnessed suspicious activity on the VTC monitor at the end of a session on or around September 1, 2021.
This allegation contradicts prior assurances from the Government and MDC Legal that Maxwell's communication difficulties had been resolved and were not being interfered with.
The email is a formal notification demanding an explanation and evidence of remediation before the issue is reported to the court.
